cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest tonight then west-northwest, tracking toward the Louisiana coast Monday and then sliding westward along the northern Gulf Coast toward southeast Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the south-central Louisiana coast between Morgan City and the Mouth of the Pearl River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Sabine Pass TX eastward to Morgan City LA (includes Port Arthur area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Tropical Storm Warning Cameron LA to west of Morgan City LA and Mouth of the Pearl River to MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas through Louisiana and Mississippi/Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds (39-57 mph) could brush the Port Arthur area late Tuesday with a 12 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds are not expected.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation above ground level possible for Sabine Pass to Intracoastal City – includes Port Arthur approaches; highest levels Monday night into Tuesday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may produce 2–4 inches of rain with isolated higher amounts, enough for localized ponding and minor flash-flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas in the Sabine Lake ship channel; isolated tornado risk cannot be ruled out as outer rainbands move inland.
